name: clonr
description: # About This project is aimed to make creating template projects very easy, so that you can set up a project one time, and not worry about configuration again.  Simply host your template project in a git repostory, configure your template variables in a .clonrrc file, as well as providing a placeholder in the  template files, and run `clonr clone <repo_url>`. The rest will unfold before your eyes.

scripts.postinstall: husky install && npm run setup:husky &&  go get && go run main.go version && npm run greeting
scripts.greeting: echo You can use the command 'npm run cz' to use commitizen to set up your commits for you. Otherwise, follow the conventional commits standard for commits
